Reviews.Title: “Tintoretto experience”
Reviews.Author: Silsden
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location, 15 mins walk from bus/train station. The staff were very pleasant and the hotel was very clean. Our room was great but could have done with tea/coffee making facilities. Breakfast was good, the usual continental style with plenty of choice in it's own breakfast come restaurant, where the pizza was good too. Location wise it was fairly central, left to rialto bridge and st marks square and right to train station and water buses etc.You can walk round easily and safely but do take a good pair of walking shoes, we tended to walk rather than use the water buses apart from taking one to murano.There were plenty of good restaurants nearby although we thought the prices were on the high side for a meal for two, but then we were in Venice! Watch out for service and cover charge.

Reviews.Title: “poor service and poor room”
Reviews.Author: richard1967a
Reviews.Content: The Staff didnt know which room to put us in, we got a room that was quite basic, poor air conditioning, no tea and coffee facillities. The shower looked as it needed a good clean and was quite small. Breakfast meant for the guests but was shared by dozens of pigeons, it was left to the guests to shoo them away, staff did nothing about it

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay at this hotel--terrible!”
Reviews.Author: smartpeopletravel
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at! Don't ever stay here. The staff is shady and dishonest. Before I arrived, the hotel emailed me a quote of 50 euro a night. When I checked out they said the rate as 150 euro a night! I have never had a hotel pull this kind of crap. In the U.S. they would be arrested. They were holding my passport and I had to leave the country so I paid it, but I called Visa and filed a complaint before checking out. The guidebook also listed the rate as 50 euro a night. The hotel isn't very nice. There is no way it is worth 150 euros a night--there are much better hotels in Venice! I have been to Europe dozens of times and stayed in dozens if not hundreds of hotels and have never come across such a bunch of shady operators.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very clean!”
Reviews.Author: sinyurita
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the train station, you can either walk or take the steamer #1 i think but its easier to walk just 10 minutes, and its off of the nuevo strada, great area, good starting point in Venice, grocery store right down the street and great place to eat almost right in front, simple breakfast , hot coffee with unlimited refills, good service, you just have to walk up , no elevators so pack light for venice. They had just finished remodeling, so it was very clean, everything was good,,,, just remember no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE ! !”
Reviews.Author: Deniseandhusband
Reviews.Content: We payd 40,-- euro a night, but it was worth not more then 20,-- euro !

Reviews.Title: “For 40 euros a night”
Reviews.Author: BuieKnife
Reviews.Content: Due to the season and a friend who prides himself on bargaining for hotel rooms, I visited Venice in January for 40 euros/night, no breakfast. For that price, it was fine. Service seemed to be non-existent, but I was out all day, so didn't care. My single room was cute with an old wooden wardrobe and an interesting view out on a marble statue maker's yard across the alley. The location was very convenient for shops and food stores. Quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable and sneaky”
Reviews.Author: Lillian-Melbourne
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Tintoretto a month in advance after meticulously sifting through all the hotels in a similar price range, I decided on Tintoretto due to good tripadvisor reviews, the price and the location. I arrived at the hotel just before midnight (which was extremely difficult to find despite my printing out the route on google maps before hand). The man at the desk began by saying that there was a problem with my room, that the shower had broken and that there was water everywhere. He continued by saying that he had a friend who had a hotel down the road, and that I would be staying there instead (which he phrased as a statement not as a request). Obviously I have no proof as to whether this was true or not, but I get the feeling that they had overbooked and had simply decided to move me at their convenience. He showed me a handwritten list of guests and their associated room numbers, to which he said "The whole floor is flooded" yet I noticed that it was only my name that had another hotel allocated to it. He said to me that if I had a problem with it, I could come back the next morning and talk to the manager as he was only the night watchman. His "friend" then appeared at the door and told me that he would take me to the second hotel. As a young female solo traveller, the idea of following a complete stranger through the deserted streets of an unknown city in the dead of the night, didn't particularly appeal to me, but Tintoretto didn't really give me any choice. The new hotel was adequate and that was it. I had paid 90â‚¬ in advance for Tintoretto and the new hotel definately wasn't worth this. Although I could have returned the next morning to complain to the manager, as I only had 2 days in Venice, I was not particularly eager to waste half my morning arguing with hotel staff nor spending the rest of the morning moving hotels. As a result of this, although I cannot actually provide a review for the rooms at Tintoretto, I will say that the service did not leave a positive impression and I would never reccommend the hotel to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best.”
Reviews.Author: toronto85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Tintoretto at the end of July, 2010. As other reviewers have mentioned, it's a little tricky to find as it's tucked away off the main street. The obvious benefit of this is the lack of street noise. The location is decent, close to a grocery store, restaurants and a nice little strip with stores and cafes. Our room was not particularly nice. Weird plastic floors and uncomfortable beds. The bathroom was clean, but not great: our toilet kept flushing for quite awhile and after asking management to fix it (which was quite difficult as the hotel workers do not speak english), someone came upstairs and showed us that we have to jiggle the flush button three times for it to stop flushing (weird). Water pressure is terrible and the handle on our shower was broken. The shower curtain is chained so it can only be pulled one way (again...weird). Walls were quite thin and our room was close to the stairs which made for a disruptful sleep. I put earplugs in the second night and was fine. The room was airconditioned and had a small tv with a few channels. Breakfast consisted of coffee, some croissants (fresh) and some yogurt and cereal. The yogurt and milk were left sitting out in the heat, so I didn't eat those. The croissants were fine. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you got an amazing deal on the room. It was perfectly acceptable, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: fastwebsiteseasy
Reviews.Content: A little out of the way, but it was clean, inexpensive and quiet. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tired & dated accommodation”
Reviews.Author: TheBoysonHoliday
Reviews.Content: We were allocated this hotel as part of a great deal booked through Travelzoo (GREAT site!). The hotel proved difficult to find and was strange in that our room was across the way from the main hotel. The room was large, quite clean and reasonably quiet but was dark and remiscent of the 80s! For the price we paid we can't grumble but if we had booked it at internet prices we would have been disappointed. Breakfast was adequate - just.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: teacherandy
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel was fine. My room had been recently renovated and was really clean. It felt very cozy. Only strange thing was that it was around the corner from the main hotel (they had a block of rooms in a side street) so I had to walk outside to the main part of the hotel to go and eat breakfast. Although this was very strange, having a room in the separate section gave me a feeling of being less of a tourist, more like a local. The breakfast was not good - dry, unappetising - felt I had to eat elsewhere to fill up. Staff were polite and efficient, although they didn't go out of their way to help.

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms, nasty staff, would avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: mikes66682
Reviews.Content: There's no elevator; the rooms are tiny, their supposedly continental breakfast is just bread and butter or cereal; the hotel has this strange policy that you can't eat or drink anything in the room, so after I would violate this policy nightly I'd have to toss my trash out the window into the canal below; the room has a safe but they charge you to use it, which I hadn't realized until checking out, but I got into a fight with the nasty receptionist and just walked out without paying for the use of the safe. The location's not great either, about 40 minutes by water bus to San Marco. Bottom line, though this is supposedly a 3-star hotel,it's REALLY NOT 3-star quality.

Reviews.Title: “saving you the trouble...”
Reviews.Author: hopefulengland
Reviews.Content: At first I would've rated this hotel as ok, not that I ever write reviews. I am writing this only to save others the awful shock we got at this hotel. The main reason I'm writing this is that on the 3rd day out of four I went to look for our passports to find they weren't in the very safe, hidden away place I knew it to be in. After panicking a fair bit and going through all our stuff several times, I made phone calls back to England and my friends tried to help us by finding out how we should proceed without passports. Eventually I advised the hotel staff that our passports had been stolen. They gestured towards their pigeon holes behind the desk and nodded. After asking why they had them and who had taken them they gave me no answers. I had no idea when someone had gone into the room and taken them - whowever had done it would have had to go through my bags thoroughly and open zips etc to find them. I was offered no explanation or apology. Furthermore, the pigeonholes were on view and accessible to all who entered the unlocked hotel door and the desk was often unstaffed so anyone could take the passports etcetera. Good points??, this hotel provides a cooler , if cramped, room in really hot weather and it is not too far from the water bus. You can also get a really bad breakfast in with the price- everything tasted of cardboard, including the dryer than dry croissants. There is fruit salad available- if you like it fresh from the tin. Most of the staff were unfriendly- our Italian is poor but they had little comprehension of English, something I didn't notice until I asked them to tell my why my passports had been taken without my permission or knowledge. This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had and I've had some bad experiences in the past, but never to the degree where I felt the responsibility to tell others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Tintoretto for 3 nights in July 2008. I had read reviews on this site before booking and was a little aprehensive. However, I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a very polite gentleman who directed us to our room. The room was clean and adequately furnished, the air conditioning was controlled from inside the room to enable us to adjust the temperature for our personal comfort. The bathroom was clean and quite large and there was plenty of hot water and clean towels. Breakfast was served between 7.30 and 9.30 in the restaurant just in front of the hotel and consisted of buffet. It included tea, coffee, orange and grapefruit juice; a variety of cereals, pastries, rolls and a range of jams and spreads. The location was excellent for exploring Venice and very close to local shops.

Reviews.Title: “It was foul.”
Reviews.Author: Lindey112
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel mid afternoon and were engulfed by a stink as soon as we entered the front door. The reception room was cramped, drity and smelly and it got worse as we carried on up the stairs (bringing all of our luggage with us- no help from the staff). The room was disgusting. The floor was lino and there were only three beds. (We were a family of 5). We were then informed that two of us would be sleeping in a different building across the road, suprising seeing as we had booked and paid for a 'family bedroom'. In the second bedroom (which was in fact a two minute walk down the street, down a dingy alley) there was only one window, and so to try and stop the stink we opened it, only to be greeted by scaffolding and rowdy italian builders. The sheets in both bedrooms were scratchy and uncomfortable, and when I flushed the toilet in bedroom 1, the flush fell off in my hand. The breakfast was fine- if you like biscuits, cold instant coffee and orange juice that tastes more like wee. The day we spent in Venice was almost ruined because all the while we were dreading returning back to that 'hotel' . If you can call it that. I have stayed in much nicer youth hostels, for much cheaper prices. Overall- do not go to this hotel unless you honestly don't mind paying good money to stay in a hovel.

Reviews.Title: “Plumbing Problem”
Reviews.Author: Qtpi_e_7
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, we were informed that due to a "plumbing" problem our room was unavailable. Fortunately, the Hotel Tintoretto receptionist already had another room reserved for us in a hotel nearby for the same price. The hotel we ended up at was Locanda Herion. It served our needs very well. Maybe next time Tintoretto will be available! Note: the hotel is within walking distance of the San Lucia train station if you packed lightly (backpacks); about a 20 minute walk which goes quickly if you are eating gelato ;) otherwise take the water bus.

Reviews.Title: “Two words describe this hotel FLEA PIT..”
Reviews.Author: iTravel_with_him
Reviews.Content: Two words describe this hotel FLEA PIT. We paid 130euro to stay one night in this excuse for a hotel . The hall and stairs smelt of stale milk, the room smelt of bleach, carpets where badly stained, the bathroom not only had some interesting non paying guests (some kind of human bugs) the shower looked like it belonged in a 1950s caravan! Really this is the type of hotel that gives Venice a bad name.. This is such a shame, as there are extremely good reasonable priced hotels and B&B all over Venice. One positive note was that the staff were friendly and the breakfast was ok. How this hotel got such a good rating is beyond me. My advice if your considering booking this hotel Donâ€™t . My advice to the hotel owner, you need to gut this building and start again! B & N, Switzerland.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & value”
Reviews.Author: TravelNow_WorkLater
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel in the seperate section of the hotel in the alley on the opposite side of the street & can say that during our 4 nights it was always clean, quiet & safe. Staff were friendly & let us check in early which meant we where free to explore early without our bags & having freshened up. The main point for me about the hotel is its great location & good value price (also easy to find) although for first time vistors perhaps you may like something closer to San Marco as this hotel is approx 20mins pleasant walk from there

Reviews.Title: “FAR FROM PERFECTO!!”
Reviews.Author: ShannonM
Reviews.Content: I am a travel consultant for a wholesale luxury Europeon tour operator in the states. Please avoid any photos posted by this hotel because they are VERY deceiving. I would have taken a picture but I was afraid my camera would melt. We had been booked two nights in Venice to do hotel inspections the end of this last October. I was shocked to find that this Exclusive Hotel was ever considered an option for any of our clients or our staff as well. We had a charming greeting from a very friendly manager behind the desk. He allowed us an early check in because our rooms were available early. Let me explain to you just why. He escorted us across the alley away from the main hotel to a narrow corridor to enter another part of the hotel. Not unusual. This was not the problem, it all happened as soon as he opened the door to this section of the hotel. GASP!!! It smelled as if someone had taken a dirty fragmented diaper and spread its containments all over the entry, halls, walls, curtains and EVEN our rooms!! It was HORRIBLE. My eyes were watering. As soon as the sweet, but abviously (smell) senses challenged manager left I opened every window in the entire building, and sprayed fruity body spray all over the room. I went on my busy way through Venice and returned exhausted to the dirty, stained and stinky entrance, halls and walls. As long as I continued to keep the windows open and spray the room I had no other option, it was to late to relocate on my study trip. There were two of us here and each room was equally as trecherous. The following morning we went down to a less than hopeful continetal breakfast where the only good thing about the hotel was found; a homemade croissant, but then were let down again by the disgusting instant coffee. Oh well. My advice to the hotel would be to strip the carpet and the halls and maybe fix the plumbing. It truly seemed that they had some flooding issue (not from the canals this building structure was on a second floor) from the sewer, and NEVER put people in here until its been done. They are going to make someone really sick. If not from the breakfast, definetly the musky moldy rotten hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but not for the infirm!”
Reviews.Author: oscararts
Reviews.Content: We booked through a call centre and got a reasonable price for the room. This hotel is in a great location with access to all areas of the main island on foot - we walked every street it seemed! Access to the hotel is normally via the vaporetto stops. They look close by on the maps but be prepared for a walk and to take your luggage up and over a few bridges to get there. Of course if you have lots of money you can take a water taxi right to the rear of the restaurant next to the hotel. We arrived earlier than planned and we were able to gain access to our room before the stated time- always a plus! The room was on the top floor of the annex and thanks to earlier reviews I knew that there was no lift. It wasn't a problem for us but if you have trouble with steps then you'll have trouble with Venice, never mind the hotel. I was surprised how few facilities there were for the disabled in the city. The location just off the Strada Nova was great. The continental breakfast in the restaurant attached was fine, cereal, dried fruits, toast, bread rolls, jam and a kettle for hot water for tea. The coffee from the urn wasn't up to much but it was no problem to get a cappuccino made together with an espresso for an extra zing! The room was large with a king bed and windows onto the canal. The decoration was a little tired but how many nights do you stay in Venice anyway? My only concern was security. The annex door was opened by request to the reception desk in the main building. That was the theory but many times we found the door wide open anyway during the day. Apart from that we had a very enjoyable stay and would consider using the hotel again. Many reveiws complain about the price and quality of food. We didn't find the prices too bad (it is a tourist city) and if you look for places where others are eating you can check out the food and the menu before you buy. The ice cream is great value at around 1 Euro a scoop. The best meal we had was at Ai Do Mati on the Gran Viale - Lido. The best pizza I ever tasted. There was so much topping it seemed like a deep dish. It was enormous and the price was less than 10 Euro. Unless you have a huge appetite order one for two people first.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Tintoretto for four nights in June/July of this year. We loved the location -- much better than the touristy Grand Canal area, which we couldn't wait to get away from. Not to mention it's a lot cheaper, too. The hotel personnel were very nice and the room (the "French room") in the hotel annex was very small but air conditioned and quite adequate for our needs, although it is not a place you want to spend a lot of time in. The continental breakfast was good, although nothing special, but the garden restaurant where it is served was very pleasant. We also had dinner at the restaurant and thought it was excellent. There are several other restaurants and bars in the immediate vicinity and also a laundromat about six blocks away, which came in very handy. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Wiggly
Reviews.Content: The Tintoretto Hotel was in a good location, walking distance to the main attractions but away from the main thorough fares. Our room which was around the corner from the main part of the hotel, was compact. The room described as a 'French Room' had a standard UK double bed and a clean en-suite shower room, old beams and traditional shutters on the windows which added character. The walls were a little thin so you could hear some noise from the restaurant below. We had a plentiful but not very exciting breakfast in the hotel restaurant. This was included in the cost of our room, so no complaints. Staff were friendly. Venice is quite expensive and you don't always get value for money in restaurants. However, don't let this cloud the enjoyment of what is undoubtedly, a stunning city on water.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Excellent Price”
Reviews.Author: MJWSanFrancisco_CA
Reviews.Content: I have visited Venice many times on a budget and this was by far one of the nicest hotels that I have ever stayed in. The staff was friendly, the location is excellent, within walking distance of the train station and the Piazza San Marco. Restaurants that are more affordable can be found in abundance, as well as a pub. The room we stayed in was identified as "Francesi" style with a warning that it and the bed were smaller than most - in fact the room was quite large, very light and airy, and the bed was simply a queen size. I liked the fact that there was a large window in the bath as well. The rooms were clean and quiet, we had no problem with hot water and yes, there was a bit of damp on the ceiling but what would you expect from a hotel located in a city that is up to its knees in water half the time? We didn't take breakfast in the hotel as we prefer to take it in a local bar/cafe for the local ambience, so can't comment on that aspect. The view was into the street and into a charming courtyard full of sculptures, the atelier of some sculptor or restoration project.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at very good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Tintoretto for three nights in February 2005. At first we thought the hotel was a little out of the way and maybe too far from the tourist areas. We were wrong and its location proved to be its blessing, it is easily accesible from two vaporetto stops and a pleasant walk or vaporetto ride from St Marks square. Our room was one of the smaller we believe but benefited from a canal view and was immaculately clean. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is a simple continental affair but offered us everything we needed to start the morning. It real bonus is its location close to the residents area of Venice meant there were several excellent restaurants and bars unspoilt by tourist menus and prices and offering lovely food at very reasonable prices. Try Lafonda Menta on Fondamenta della Misericordia from fabulous Itallian food. Some guests may find themselves located in an annex of this hotel only thirty metres away, no real problem and the bonus is even bigger rooms than normal. Our one and only complaint but this is one of Venice more than the hotel is the smell from the canal/sewers that founs its way into our room. Guess there is little that can be done about that unless you take a room without the view - your choice.

Reviews.Title: “It was great in the annex!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in early April 2004. Having read an earlier comment on TripAdvisor and pondered the thought of a hotel selling itself on the fact it was remodelled almost a decade ago, we were bracing ourselves. But we'd got a great deal for a last minute booking, and it was only for two nights, so what the heck! But we need not have worried. We found the hotel without too much trouble, and check in was smooth and effecient in the cramped reception area. Staff were friendly, helpful, and of course spoke excellent English. The first surprise was being shown to our room by being taken back outside the hotel, across the square, and down a dubious looking narrow alleyway behind a kebab shop! However, once inside the decor was modern and fresh. Our room, judging by the floor plan, was the largest one of the five in the annex. In fact it could have slept five (as in addition to the double bed there was a fold-out double and single bed in the room). The bathroom was clean and modern, although the shower took a little while to get hot. We got the impression that this annex might be a new addition to the hotel. We thought it a nice touch that the hotel had provided umberellas in a stand by the door for use of guests getting to and from the main hotel building in the event of a downpour. If we had a negative point to make it was about breakfast itself. The dining room was miniscule, with a two foot square area that contained croissants, jams, cereals, etc that you were invited to help yourself to - which would have been interesting had there been more than six people in the dining room! It wasn't the best quality breakfast we've had on our travels. That aside, the hotel was in a central location and easy to walk to from the bus station. Venice itself is a terrific place to visit and we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “tintoretto no masterpiece”
Reviews.Author: blondie1344
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in a good location of Venice. The staff is friendly and polite. The public rooms (lobby and breakfast rooms are attractive). There is no elevator, so be prepared to haul you luggage several flights. Although the rooms were supposedly remodeled in 1995, we found our two rooms to be unattractive. The rooms were cramped and cheaply furnished. The carpeting was stained, threadbare, and moldy. Hot water was tepid at best. Although we had planned to stay 4 nights, we left after the fourth because of the above problems. The management insisted on charging us for one extra night, which I have never encountered elsewhere. Even though Venice hotels are notoriously costly and small, I think one can do better.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Tintoretto
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio Santa Fosca 2316, 30121 Venice, Italy
